ygData.subject: Re: Lock picking the Hole
ygData.msgSnippet: This is definitely not true.  Just this week, I was bored and decided to try to figure out how to use the lockpicks I had bought when I got the lockpicking
ygData.messageBody:
This is definitely not true. Just this week, I was bored and decided to try
to figure out how to use the lockpicks I had bought when I got the
lockpicking skill. I just happened to be in West Commons, so I headed on
over to Befallen. I finally discovered that you can pick ALL the Befallen
locks by holding the lockpick on your cursor and left-clicking on the door.
I opened each door several times, never got a failure, but never got a skill
raise either. I don't remember if I had trained several points into the
skill or not (I may have; I had a lot of training points to waste)

About the Hole entrance rock thing; I went along on a Hole raid around
level 40 (yeah, a little young, but you know how those caster's want their
crack song... hehe). Apparently you might not even need the locked rock
picked as there is some space around it you may be able to swim through (of
course SOMEONE has to let the big races in).

Interesting thing about the raid was that they brought along a few level 1-3
rogues along to sneak/hide their way around for corpse recovery... Worked
really well too! =8^)

Which brings up another question of mine... It seemed that those level 1-3
rogues worked wonders with Sneak/Hide. Now, being level 1-3 they're
sneak/hide skills can't be all that high (unless like Iksars that are born
with Swimming skill of 100). Now, how well does bard sneak/hide work
compared with level 3 rogues? Is there some technique to using sneak/hide?
I tried sneaking behind something in Kaesora the other day and the mob
immediately aggroed on me.

Olgwinn Pendragun
Bard of 45 Missed Notes
E'ci



> Date: Thu, 14 Sep 2000 22:01:05 -0500
> From: "Bill Mann" <dabard@...>
>Subject: Re: Lock picking the Hole
>
>Hmmm... I thought I saw a patch message a while back about the locks in
>Befallen being changed so you couldn't pick them anymore?
>
>
